com.net2plan.utils

Class CollectionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.net2plan.utils.CollectionUtils

  • public class CollectionUtils
extends Object

    Provides extra functionality for the Java Collections Framework. For Java primitives check the corresponding xxxUtils class.

    Since:
    0.3.0
    Author:
    Pablo Pavon-Marino, Jose-Luis Izquierdo-Zaragoza

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public static <A> boolean contains(Collection<A> collection,
                                   A value)
        Checks if an input collection contains a given value.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        collection - Input collection
        value - Value to search
        Returns:
        true if value is present in collection, and false otherwise. If collection is empty, it will return false

      • containsAll

        public static <A> boolean containsAll(Collection<A> container,
                                      Collection<A> collection)
        Checks whether all elements of a collection are present in another one.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        container - Container collection
        collection - Collection with elements to be checked
        Returns:
        true if all elements in collection are present in container, and false otherwise. If container is empty, it will return false

      • containsAny

        public static <A> boolean containsAny(Collection<A> collection1,
                                      Collection<A> collection2)
        Checks whether any element of a collection is present in another one.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        collection1 - Container collection
        collection2 - Collection with elements to be checked
        Returns:
        true if any element in collection is present in container, and false otherwise. If container is empty, it will return false

      • convertId2LinearIndexMap

        public static <A extends Number> Map<A,Integer> convertId2LinearIndexMap(Set<A> elements)

        Returns a map containing the association of each element with its corresponding position within the set (in linear order). First element will be associate to index 0, second element to index 1, and so on.

        Important: Since this method is widely used within the tool to deal with conversion between node/link/whatever identifier to its corresponding linear index (first element will be item 0, second element will be item 1, and so on), it is required that in iterator order the elements follow an asceding order.

        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        elements - Set of elements in ascending iterator order (null values are not allowed)
        Returns:
        Element to linear index mapping

      • count

        public static <A> Map<A,Integer> count(Collection<A> collection)
        Returns a map where each entry represents the number of times that the corresponding key appears in the input collection.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        collection - Input collection
        Returns:
        Map where the key is an item appearing in the input collection, and the value is the number of times that appears

      • find

        public static <A,B> List<A> find(Map<A,B> map,
                                 B value,
                                 Constants.SearchType searchType)
        Returns the key(s) where a given value can be found into a map.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        B - Value type
        Parameters:
        map - Input map
        value - Value to be searched for
        searchType - Indicates whether the first, the last, or all occurrences are returned
        Returns:
        Key(s) in which the given value can be found (in iteration order)

        public static <A,B> org.apache.commons.collections15.Transformer<A,B> getMapTransformer(Map<A,B> map)
        Obtains the equivalent Transformer of a Map.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        B - Value type
        Parameters:
        map - Input map
        Returns:
        Transformer

      • intersect

        public static <A> Set<A> intersect(Collection<A>... collections)
        Returns the intersection set of a series of input collections. There is no order guarantee.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        collections - Series of input collections
        Returns:
        Intersection set of input collections

      • join

        public static <A> String join(Collection<A> collection,
                              String separator)
        Joins the elements in an input collection using a given separator.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        Parameters:
        collection - Input collection
        separator - Separator
        Returns:

      • listOf

        public static <A> List<A> listOf(A... values)
        Returns a list of the comma-separated input values.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Value type
        Parameters:
        values - Comma-separated input values
        Returns:
        List of values (iteration order equal to insertion order)

      • select

        public static <A,B> List<B> select(Map<A,B> map,
                                   Collection<A> keys)
        Returns a list of the values of the selected elements from an input map. It is not backed in the input map, thus changes in this list are not reflected in the input map.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        B - Value type
        Parameters:
        map - Input map
        keys - Keys of the elements to be selected
        Returns:
        List of the values associated to the input indexes (in iteration order)

      • selectEntries

        public static <A,B> Map<A,B> selectEntries(Map<A,B> map,
                                           Set<A> keys)
        Returns a map of selected elements from the input map. It is not backed in the input map, thus changes in the returned one are not reflected in the input map.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        B - Value type
        Parameters:
        map - Input map
        keys - Keys of the elements to be selected.
        Returns:
        Map containing the entries corresponding to the keys in the input set (in iteration order)

      • setOf

        public static <A> Set<A> setOf(A... values)
        Returns a set of the comma-separated input values.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Value type
        Parameters:
        values - Comma-separated input values
        Returns:
        Set of values (iteration order equal to insertion order)

      • sort

        public static <A extends Comparable<A>,B extends Comparable<B>> SortedMap<A,B> sort(Map<A,B> map,
                                                                                    Constants.OrderingType orderingType)
        Returns a SortedMap copy of the input map according to the values.
        Type Parameters:
        A - Key type
        B - Value type
        Parameters:
        map - Input map
        orderingType - Ascending or descending
        Returns:
        SortedMap. For keys sharing the same value, entries will be ordered according to ascending order of keys.

      • toMap

        public static <K> Map<K,Double> toMap(Collection<K> keys,
                                      DoubleMatrix1D vals)
        Given a collection of keys and an array of values, returns a map.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Key type
        Parameters:
        keys - Input keys
        vals - Input
        Returns:
        Map containing the entries corresponding to the input keys and values
